info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 6 at 12:14AM EDT until June 6 at 12:15PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis IN
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Indianapolis IN has issued a Flood Warning for the following river in Indiana...
Mississinewa River near Ridgeville.
.Brief flooding is expected along the Mississinewa River near Ridgeville due to 1 to 2 inches of rain that fell from Wednesday night through Thursday night.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Mississinewa River near Ridgeville.
* WHEN...From early this morning to this afternoon.
* IMPACTS...At 11.5 feet, Water on the shoulder and edge of SR 1 south of the junction with SR 28 in western Randolph County.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:00 AM EDT Friday the stage was 10.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 12:00 AM EDT Friday was 10.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 11.7 feet early this morning. It will then fall below flood stage this morning. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind.
The next statement should be issued this afternoon by around 1215 PM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING TO THIS AFTERNOON
